articles.author: Andrew Goudsward, Andrew Chung, John Kruzel
articles.description: Donald Trump got another break when the U.S. Supreme Court signaled some support for his immunity claim, even as more of his allies faced prosecution for the former president's attempts to overturn his 2020 election loss.
articles.title: Trump election subversion case bogs down as allies' legal woes grow

articles.author: Dhanya Skariachan, Chris Thomas, Nikunj Ohri
articles.description: India began voting on Friday in the second phase of the world's biggest election, as Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his rivals raise the pitch of the campaign by focusing on hot-button issues such as religious discrimination, affirmative action and taxes.
articles.title: India begins voting in second phase of giant election as Modi vs Gandhi campaign heats up

articles.author: Simon Lewis
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken met Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi in Beijing on Friday for talks across a range of complex issues, including deepening strains over China's backing of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
articles.title: Blinken meets Chinese counterpart Wang Yi in Beijing

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The vast amount of rubble including unexploded ordnance left by Israel's devastating war in the Gaza Strip could take about 14 years to remove, a United Nations official said on Friday.
articles.title: UN official says it could take 14 years to clear debris in Gaza

articles.author: Andrew Osborn
articles.description: Sergei Shoigu, Russia's defence minister, has tried to send a "business as usual" message since his deputy was arrested on a bribery charge. But the widening scandal looks bad for him too, and is seen as a push by a rival clan to dilute his power.
articles.title: Arrest of Russian defence minister's deputy may be strike by rival 'clan'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The threat of deportation to Rwanda is causing migrants to head for Ireland instead of staying in Britain, Ireland's deputy prime minister told a British newspaper on Friday.
articles.title: Ireland says UK's Rwanda policy drives migrants over its border

articles.author: Jack Queen, Jody Godoy, Andy Sullivan
articles.description: Former National Enquirer publisher David Pecker will answer more questions about his efforts to suppress damaging information about Donald Trump during the 2016 election, as the former president's criminal hush-money trial continues on Friday.
articles.title: Former tabloid publisher to face more questions in Trump hush-money trial

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Two men accused of spying for China, including a former researcher for a prominent British lawmaker in the governing Conservative Party, appeared in a London court on Friday.
articles.title: Two men accused of being Chinese spies appear in London court

articles.author: Lucien Libert
articles.description: Students blocked access to Paris' prestigious Sciences Po university over the war in Gaza on Friday, demanding the institution condemn Israel's actions, in a protest that echoed similar demonstrations on U.S. campuses.
articles.title: Students block Paris' Sciences Po university over Gaza war

articles.author: Layli Foroudi
articles.description: A police crackdown that aims to clear a poor suburb of petty crime and street vendors before the Paris 2024 Olympics is putting pressure on an overcrowded prison operating at almost double its capacity.
articles.title: Ahead of Olympics, a packed Paris prison braces for crowds of inmates
